info.name: Spinal cord, central canal
info.description: Technically, the central canal of the spinal cord is the narrow lumen of the spinal cord that extends up through the caudal portion of the medulla to communicate with the fourth ventricle at the level of the obex. This canal is lined with ependymal cells indicative of its origin from the embryonic neural canal, but for all practical purposes it is non-patent and serves no function.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/9 Cord-Medulla Junction
